children.subject: Would also be interested but I don't know yet if I would have the time for it. ryan.a@berkeley.edu
Might be willing to help out a little bit! ryanleh@berkeley.edu

Interested in the mathematical aspects of cryptography -- willing to help in fall 2020!

swjin@berkeley.edu

history.content:
Hello!

I was wondering if anyone would be interested in trying to start a DeCal on cryptography for the upcoming Fall 2020 semester. We would go through the planning process through this next spring in time to start for the beginning of the next academic year. My current vision of it is that it would be mostly a survey of cryptographic algorithms as well as basic concepts such as public- and secret-key cryptography, MACs, and so on and so forth. It would probably also be slightly less proof-based so as to not deter the general population, but again, everything is flexible for now.

My main reasoning for trying to get this start is that the CS 176 class doesn’t ever seem to have been offered, but even if it is, it’s definitely not a low barrier to entry class, which is what I would like the DeCal to sort of be like.

If anyone is interested, follow up below, and we can work something out! I definitely can’t do this alone!

Thanks!

Nicholas Ngai

P.S.: I know CS 161 exists, as well, but this would probably focus more on the cryptography aspects rather than the broader field of computer security.
history.subject: Cryptography DeCal for Fall 2020
